Author: iamwil
Content:
I think it's in the transition right now. For the past couple years, it mostly has been an exploration of different forms of the web.

A lot of people anticipate mobile platform to be next, but things are pretty grim so far--but people make due. RFIDs are another thing that has people excited, as well as 3D printing.

Author: dshah
Content:
This is way better than the original article. Takes a more detailed look at what might be going on over there.

I think the key point (for me) was the notion that great developers like to build new things.

Author: brlewis
Content:
Ability to check if one URL is submitted already, but then submit another.

E.g. you want to submit\n http://example.com/#part2

But first check if someone has submitted\n http://example.com/

Right now you either have to submit your less-preferred URL, or browse around and use google to see if the less-preferred URL has already been submitted.

Author: prakash
Content:
There is a lot of value in lessons learned. In which case it makes sense to post a link to the fix/solution rather than point out that its broken.

my 2 cents.

Author: drm237
Title: PG on Y Combinator
Content: aul is a great guy and has built a huge following in the startup community. I have a lot of respect for him and what he has done. Y Combinator is a great story. Paul agreed to share some details with me. Here it is live and uncut.

Author: migpwr
Content:
The reason it's posted is probably because information on the cause of the outtage could be useful to startups. An opportunity for lessons learned...

Obviously this only applies if the outtage is a result of problem with their infrastructure or software.

Author: transburgh
Title: YouTube Down at 9:00am EST
Content: First Skype, then Digg, now YouTube. Who will be next?

Author: prakash
Content: I am the only one to see the irony in this? What's the point of posting information about a website that is down? I can understand if its a service like Skype but digg...
